name: versatile
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 able to change easily from one activity to another or able to be used for many different purposes: He's a very versatile young actor who's as happy in highbrow dramas as he is in TV comedies. A leather jacket is a timeless and versatile garment that can be worn in all seasons.
More examplesFewer examplesThis jacket is very versatile - you can dress it up for the evening.He is a very versatile actor.We want all our staff to be versatile.This is a very versatile recipe - you can double the portions for a party.Teachers have to be versatile to cope with different ability levels.
